title: Sources: Mavericks expected to fire GM Harrison
content: The Dallas Mavericks are expected to fire general manager Nico Harrison on Tuesday, sources tell ESPN.

title: Kelly files suit, says LSU seeking 'for cause' firing
content: In a legal filing Monday, Brian Kelly's attorneys say LSU has taken the position that it has not "formally terminated" Kelly as the Tigers' football coach and is now seeking to fire him "for cause" and potentially avoid paying his full $54 million buyout.

title: Richardson, NBA star before ban, dies at age 70
content: Four-time NBA All-Star Micheal Ray Richardson, who was once banned from the NBA for drug use, died after a short battle with prostate cancer at the age of 70.

title: New Eagles LB Phillips 'showed out' in 10-7 win
content: A week after being traded from Miami to Philadelphia, new Eagles linebacker Jaelan Phillips played 52 snaps, racked up seven pressures, six tackles, two quarterback hits and a fumble recovery in his club's 10-7 win over the Packers on Monday night.

title: NCAA settles with unpaid coaches for $303M
content: The NCAA has agreed to pay $303 million to settle a class action antitrust lawsuit representing about 7,700 volunteer college coaches who alleged the organization engaged in illegal wage fixing under a rule that prohibited schools from paying them.

title: Love: Packers offense 'letting the defense down'
content: A strong effort from the Packers defense Monday night coincided with one of the worst offensive games in Jordan Love's three seasons as the starter, prompting the QB to remark, "You feel like as an offense you're letting the defense down."

title: Pistons' Cunningham has 46 on 45 shots in OT win
content: Pistons star Cade Cunningham scored 46 points on 45 shots in a wild overtime win vs. the Wizards. His 31 misses were the most since the 1976-77 merger.

title: Heat steal OT win with buzzer-beating lob play
content: The Miami Heat sealed a thrilling 140-138 victory over the Cavaliers off a brilliantly designed out-of-bounds play that ended in an Andrew Wiggins alley-oop dunk.

title: McDermott backs Brady; not eyeing Daboll for staff
content: Bills coach Sean McDermott said Monday he was "fully confident" in offensive coordinator Joe Brady and his staff following a blowout loss to the Dolphins in Week 10.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus each team's non-QB MVP at midseason
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 11. Plus, we picked every team's MVP -- not including quarterbacks.

title: Packers fall to Eagles in defensive bout
content: If you're a fan of offense, Monday night in Green Bay was ugly. If defense is your thing, it was a thing of beauty.

title: Wetzel: Feds are the best hope to police sports betting's wild west
content: In the end, the fear of being busted is about the only universal deterrent. Prison is a powerful disincentive.

title: What's real and what's a mirage so far? We have verdicts on six early-season NBA trends
content: From the Bulls' hot start to the onslaught of free throws, ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton explores which early-season trends are real or not.

title: Friends, family reel after Marshawn Kneeland's death
content: 'It's hard to understand': Marshawn Kneeland's death has left loved ones reeling, according to interviews with his family, agent and former teammates.

title: Inside an unbelievable $241M week for Austin Reaves and the Lakers
content: The Lakers' fifth-year guard now sits at the center of two major NBA storylines: Helping the team win enough to convince LeBron James to stay in L.A., but playing so well that it might cost the franchise nearly $250M dollars to keep him.

content: The idea initially sounded so far-fetched band directors thought it was a prank. But the collaboration became a sensation.

content: Some high-profile recruiting classes lost their coaches, leaving big questions about players who could flip.

content: Who has overachieved or underachieved in the first month, and will it continue? Here are four teams in each category.

title: Catrick Mahomes to Cee Dee Little Lamb: Trending sports-related pet names of 2025
content: "Josh Allen" was up 232% for sports-inspired cat names this year, according to a recent report by pet-sitting website Rover.

content: From stars with millions in off-court endorsements to those making the minimum, every WNBA player stands to gain in the new CBA.

title: Are Chelsea meeting expectations? 9 stats that explain their confusing season
content: Success and failure is obvious for every Premier League team ... except Chelsea. How should we make sense of their season so far?

title: Are you not entertained? Barça aren't Europe's best, but they're the best to watch
content: While Barcelona is not perfect, they are the most entertaining team in Europe, and that's worth celebrating.

title: Why PSG are in trouble ahead of Manchester United UWCL trip
content: Paris Saint-Germain were expecting to push on and compete in the UWCL, instead they are struggling. What's going on in Paris?

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Vergil Ortiz Jr. knocks Erickson Lubin out of top 10
content: Vergil Ortiz Jr. needed less than two rounds to retain the WBC interim junior middleweight title. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: Heisman Trophy race: Who can still challenge Indiana's Fernando Mendoza?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy race, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet it heading into Week 12.

title: Bihar Election 2025 Phase 2 Voting LIVE Updates: Bihar Records Highest Turnout Of 67.14% Till 5 PM
content: Voter enthusiasm continued to mark the second and final phase of the Bihar Assembly elections, with an impressive 60.40% turnout recorded across the constituencies until 3 pm.

title: Record Turnout In Bihar Election, Test For Nitish Kumar's Cabinet: 10 Points
content: Phase 2 of assembly polls in Bihar today saw the highest ever turnout, with over 60% voting till 5.30 pm. Voting is being held on 122 seats, from where a chunk of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's cabinet is seeking re-election.

title: Bihar Election Poll Of Exit Poll Results 2025 Live Updates: 3 Exit Polls Predict NDA Sweep In Bihar, Poor Show By Prashant Kishor's Party
content: Voting in the second and final phase of the Bihar assembly elections has ended. Now it's time to find out what the exit polls have predicted for the state.

title: Images Show Myanmar Scam Hub Largely Standing Despite Crackdown
content: A declared military crackdown has left some destruction at a major scam compound in Myanmar, satellite images analysed by AFP show, but most buildings are still standing in pictures taken up to Sunday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'PhD' Handlers To Faridabad 'Doctors', How 'White-Collar' Terrorism Isn't New
content: From ISIS chief Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, who held a PhD, to Al-Qaeda's Ayman al-Zawahiri, a surgeon, and Laden, a civil engineering graduate - some of the world's most extremist leaders have come from classrooms, universities and privileged backgrounds.

title: 'Come Home, Hidma': Mother Of India's Most Wanted Maoist To Son
content: In a scene few thought possible in one of India's most conflict-scarred regions, Chhattisgarh Deputy Chief Minister and Home Minister Vijay Sharma rode a motorcycle deep into the forests of Poorvarti village.

title: 'She Betrayed Me': Man Stabs Woman At Bus Stop, Wipes Hands On Her Scarf
content: One-sided love turned into brutal violence when a 23-year-old woman was murdered in the middle of the road in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district on Tuesday.

title: Video: Heated Exchange Between BJP MLA, Party Official During 'Unity March
content: A 'Unity March' organised by the BJP in Bilaspur on Tuesday to mark the 150th birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, India's Iron Man, briefly turned contentious after a heated argument broke out between a BJP leader and party official.

title: Bhopal Model Death: Post-Mortem Reveals Pregnancy, Family Alleges Murder
content: A 21-year-old model, Khushboo Verma (Ahirwar), was found dead under suspicious circumstances early Monday morning, sending shockwaves through Bhopal's fashion circuit.

title: Delhi Suicide Attack Suspect Went Underground 3 Days Before Bombing Near Red Fort
content: Three days before the suicide bombing attack near Delhi's Red Fort, the suspect Dr Umar Nabi had switched off his phone and his family had been unable to reach him.

title: Top Court Concerned After Kerala Students 'Coerced' To Speak Hindi In Delhi
content: "We are one country", the Supreme Court asserted on Tuesday while expressing concern over a recent incident in Delhi where two students from Kerala were allegedly assaulted by police and locals near the Red Fort, "coerced" to speak Hindi.

title: "Why Apprehensive": Top Court Raps Tamil Nadu On SIR, Gives Notice To Poll Body
content: An exasperated Supreme Court questioned today why the critics of the voter roll revision exercise are so "apprehensive" about it.

title: New CCTV Footage Shows Delhi Suicide Bomber At Toll Plaza, Wearing Mask
content: As investigators trace the journey of the Hyundai i20 used in the Delhi bombing from Faridabad to the Red Fort area, new CCTV footage has emerged showing the car at the Badarpur toll plaza.

title: Six Ancient Roman-Era Statues Stolen From National Museum In Syria
content: Thieves broke into the national museum in the Syrian capital and stole several ancient statues dating back to the Roman era, officials said Tuesday.

title: 'Struggled To Ensure He Gets Education': Family Of Delhi Blast Case Accused
content: The family of the man suspected to be involved in the Delhi blast near Red Fort metro station said they cannot believe that he could be involved in terror activities.

title: 'Flash, Fire And Blood': Survivors Recount Horror Of Delhi Red Fort Blast
content: "People were lying on the road, some bleeding, some not moving at all. There was blood everywhere. We saw death from up close," said Ram Pratap, lying on a hospital bed with his right arm tightly bandaged, recalling the Red Fort blast.

title: Delhi Blast Live Updates: Anti-Terror Agency NIA Takes Over Case
content: Delhi Blast Live Updates: The blast near Red Fort, in which nine people died, is being probed as a terror attack, with the Delhi Police invoking UAPA (Unlawful Activities Prevention Act) sections.

title: "Her Behaviour Was Strange": Professor Recalls Terror Accused Doctor
content: Shahin Shahid, a doctor, till recently would have passed as just another professional, going about doing her work. But no one who worked with her had the faintest idea who she really was.

title: CCTV Video Shows People Running In Fear After Delhi Blast
content: A deadly blast near Red Fort in New Delhi on Monday evening killed nine and injured 20. At 6:52 pm, a slow-moving Hyundai i20 exploded at a traffic stop near the Red Fort Metro Station leaving mutilated bodies and damaged cars scattered in the area.

title: "Woh Chala Gaya": Delhi Blast Victim Supported Family Of 4, Sister's Kids
content: "Aaj woh chala hi gaya (Today, he is gone)," wailed one of 35-year-old Jumman Mohammed's family members at the mortuary where the Delhi suicide blast victim's body was kept.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Brighton's Minteh
content: Could Liverpool end up signing Yankuba Minteh from Brighton & Hove Albion? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bihar poll of exit polls: NDA to roar back to power with 148 seats; what pollsters said
content: Exit polls indicate a strong win for the NDA in the Bihar elections. The alliance is expected to secure a majority of seats. The RJD-led Mahagathbandhan is projected to fall short. High voter turnout was recorded in both phases of the polling. The results will shape the political landscape of Bihar.

title: Bihar exit polls show NDA sweep: JD(U) says 'stamp' on Nitish govt; 'not accurate', says Cong
content: Exit polls predict a sweeping victory for the NDA in Bihar, with leaders celebrating the predicted outcome. Conversely, Mahagathbandhan leaders dismissed the polls as speculative, expressing confidence in their own victory. The counting of votes is scheduled for Friday.

title: 'Hunt down each & every culprit': Amit Shah says Delhi blast culprits to face 'full wrath of agencies'
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has ordered a relentless pursuit to apprehend all individuals involved in the devastating i20 car blast near the Red Fort. The high-intensity explosion claimed at least 12 lives and injured 30, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh vowing that perpetrators will face severe justice.

title: Turkish military plane with 20 aboard catches fire mid-air, crashes in Georgia - watch
content: A Turkish military cargo plane crashed in Georgia Tuesday. The C-130 aircraft was carrying 20 people. It took off from Azerbaijan and was returning to Turkey. The crash happened near the Azerbaijani border. Search and rescue operations are underway. Leaders from Turkey and Azerbaijan expressed deep sadness and offered condolences.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
content: Meta's Chief AI Officer, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, comparing the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding'—hands-on experimentation with AI—to gain a significant advantage in the future economy. This approach emphasizes rapid learning through prompting and refining AI outputs.

title: IRCTC hotel corruption case: Court rejects Lalu, Rabri plea for 1-week gap in hearings
content: A Delhi court dismissed Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi's plea for a one-week gap between hearings in the IRCTC Hotels corruption case. The court cited High Court directions for day-to-day listing until witness examination concludes. The case involves alleged corruption in hotel tender awards during Yadav's tenure as railway minister.

title: Sam Altman gets served: OpenAI CEO subpoenaed on stage; here’s what happened next
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman was served a subpoena onstage in San Francisco for an upcoming criminal trial involving anti-AI protesters.  The San Francisco Public Defender's Office stated Altman is a potential witness for the "Stop AI" group, whose members are accused of blocking OpenAI's offices.  The group claims their actions oppose AI's existential threat to humanity.

title: Red Fort blast: Shubman Gill reacts: 'Disturbed by the distressing events'
content: Shubman Gill expressed deep sorrow following a tragic car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort that claimed 12 lives.  The incident has prompted heightened security in Kolkata ahead of India's Test series against South Africa. The government has entrusted the National Investigation Agency with probing the blast, signaling a potential terror angle.

title: Bihar exit polls: NDA projected to retain power in Bihar; big boost to Nitish
content: Opinion polls released on Tuesday overwhelmingly predicted a decisive victory for the NDA in Bihar, projecting a significant majority. Conversely, exit polls indicated a setback for the Tejashwi-led Mahagathbandhan, with projections showing a considerable drop in seat share compared to the previous election. Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party also appears set for a subdued performance in its debut.

title: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce urged to elevate fashion at Michelin-star NYC spot
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce navigated The Polo Bar's strict dress code for their recent Manhattan dinner.  The celebrity couple, known for their impeccable style, ensured their outfits adhered to the smart and elegant attire policy.  Sources revealed they appeared nervous about complying, highlighting the restaurant's commitment to treating all guests equally, regardless of fame.

title: ‘Don’t have notifications’: JPMorgan chief ignores most texts; keeps phone off at work
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, despite leading a massive bank, limits his phone use at work, turning off notifications and ignoring texts unless from his children. He prioritizes focus in meetings, believing distractions hinder engagement. Dimon also advocates for US schools to evolve, integrating crucial skills like coding and cybersecurity to prepare students for the modern workforce.

title: Rizwan's Pakistan captaincy sack: Afridi breaks silence - 'Good human'
content: Shaheen Shah Afridi revealed he accepted Pakistan's ODI captaincy after Mohammad Rizwan voluntarily stepped down. Afridi emphasized a collaborative approach, seeking advice from all, including former captains, and stressed collective team responsibility for improvement. He aims to lead Pakistan in the 2027 World Cup, backing both in-form and struggling players.

title: 'Where are the bedbugs?' Giri lashes out at Goa's criticism
content: Anish Giri has downplayed criticism of FIDE World Cup conditions in Goa, calling some claims exaggerated. While acknowledging challenges like jet lag and different food for Western players, he noted the availability of Western dishes and reasonable spice levels. Giri also humorously dismissed reports of bedbugs, suggesting they might stem from misidentification and a lack of firsthand experience.

title: U19 triangular series: Why Suryavanshi 'not considered' for selection? BCCI clarifies
content: The BCCI has announced India A U19 and India B U19 squads for an upcoming triangular series featuring Afghanistan U19. Vaibhav Suryavanshi was omitted as he is selected for the ACC Rising Stars Asia Cup, while Ayush Mhatre is unavailable due to Ranji Trophy participation. The tri series begins on November 17 in Bengaluru.

title: Canada’s immigration plan: 50% cut in international student intake; fallout looms
content: Canada will admit fewer temporary residents, including international students, over the next three years. This move aims to bring migration rates to sustainable levels. The number of study permits will be cut by about 50%. This will impact universities and colleges financially. They will need to adjust recruitment and domestic enrollment strategies.

title: US Senate votes to end longest-ever shutdown - what now?
content: President Donald Trump has already endorsed the deal, calling it “a very good package” and promising to “open up the country very quickly.”The House, which has been on recess since mid-September, will reconvene Wednesday to vote on the measure.

title: Is Stephen Curry playing tonight vs OKC? Warriors star’s status revealed
content: Warriors fans are holding their breath as Stephen Curry's return from illness remains uncertain ahead of the Oklahoma City Thunder clash. The 37-year-old's lingering cold has sidelined him for three consecutive games, impacting the team's performance. His presence is crucial for the struggling Warriors, currently at an even 5-5 record, as they face a tough schedule.

title: Delhi blast: UP doc was tasked with forming Jaish's women wing; Pulwama link emerges
content: A woman doctor, Dr. Shaheen Sayeed, is a key suspect in a terror investigation involving a "white-collar" network. The probe intensified after a deadly car blast near Delhi's Red Fort, linked to the Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed. Eight individuals, including three doctors, were arrested with significant explosives seized.

title: Belichick’s daughter-in-law appears to snub Jordon Hudson during UNC win
content: Tension simmered at a North Carolina football game as Bill Belichick's girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, and daughter-in-law, Jennifer Schmitt, reportedly kept their distance. This follows a public online spat, with Hudson's necklace seemingly referencing a rumored ban from team facilities. Despite the Tar Heels' wins, off-field family drama continues to draw attention.

title: Delhi blast: With three occupants in i20 car, does it rule out a fidayeen attack?
content: Security agencies are probing a Red Fort blast, questioning if a fidayeen attack is plausible with three occupants in the car. Initial theories pointed to a suicide mission, but multiple individuals and CCTV footage suggest otherwise. Investigators are exploring accidental detonation or a botched transport of explosives to another target.

title: Hilarious! From Anand to Giri, chess stars get Candidates venue wrong — Watch
content: Cyprus will host the 2026 FIDE Candidates and Women's Candidates tournaments. The events are scheduled for March 28 to April 16, 2026, near Paphos. Several players have already qualified. The FIDE World Cup in Goa will determine three more Candidates spots. India's R Praggnanandhaa is expected to top the 2025 FIDE Circuit.

title: New season, old Delhi: Sr selector lands in US mid-season
content: Delhi cricket is in crisis mode — on-field failures mirror the chaos off it. With the DDCA mired in infighting, unauthorised league scandals, and selection controversies, Delhi’s Ranji team has slumped to a new low as they were hammered by Jammu & Kashmir at home in the Ranji Trophy. Poor preparation, lack of direction under coach Sarandeep Singh, and internal politics has left the Delhi team in a lurch.

title: Ronaldo's retirement: Will he play FIFA WC 2026? Legend clears air
content: Football icon Cristiano Ronaldo has revealed the 2026 FIFA World Cup will likely mark his swansong, aiming to compete at 41.  Despite nearing the twilight of his career, the prolific scorer, who recently extended his contract with Al-Nassr until 2027, feels fit and sharp.  He remains focused on securing the one major trophy missing from his illustrious career.

title: Pakistan suicide blast: Car explodes near Islamabad court; 12 killed
content: A suicide blast in Islamabad's Kacheri area killed at least 12 people and injured several others on Tuesday. Authorities have sealed the site and launched an investigation, recovering body parts believed to be of the suspected bomber. The incident follows a separate explosion at the Supreme Court cafeteria, raising security concerns.

title: 'Amit Shah should resign': Oppn targets Centre over Delhi blast; BJP hits back
content: Opposition parties have fiercely criticized the Centre following a deadly car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort. Leaders demanded Home Minister Amit Shah's resignation, citing alleged intelligence failures and past terror incidents. They questioned the government's ability to ensure national security, while the BJP accused them of politicizing a tragedy and undermining investigations.

title: Patrick & Brittany Mahomes celebrate with custom ‘his and hers’ fitness bands
content: Patrick and Brittany Mahomes have partnered with WHOOP, launching custom "His & Hers" fitness bands. This collaboration highlights their commitment to personal performance and wellness, extending their business ventures beyond sports and into technology. The wearable tracks key health metrics, offering scientifically-backed insights for users.

title: Bihar elections: How accurate have predictions been in the past; who came closest to the mark?
content: Exit polls for the Bihar Assembly elections are set to be released following the conclusion of the final phase of voting. These surveys offer an early indication of voter preferences, though past predictions for Bihar have significantly deviated from actual results. The article highlights the inaccuracies of exit polls in both the 2020 and 2015 Bihar Assembly elections.

title: The Bartlett story — a swimmer-turned-pacer; Virat Kohli's conqueror
content: Xavier Bartlett, a former champion swimmer, has made a remarkable transition to cricket, impressing in his fifth ODI by dismantling India's top order. Mentored by Andy Bichel, Bartlett's ability to swing the new ball consistently and his athletic prowess, honed in the pool, make him a bright prospect for Australian cricket across all formats.

title: Exclusive - Bigg Boss 19's Abhishek Bajaj calls cheating allegations by ex-wife 'baseless'
content: Abhishek Bajaj, recently eliminated from Bigg Boss 19, has strongly refuted cheating allegations made by his ex-wife, Akanksha Jindal. He labeled her a "social parasite and fame digger," asserting their divorce was mutual and amicable. Bajaj emphasized his loyalty in relationships and friendships, urging viewers to judge him by his actions within the house.

title: Veterans Day 2025: What’s open, what’s closed, and how the US will observe holiday
content: Veterans Day 2025 falls on Tuesday, November 11, honoring military service. Most government offices, including post offices and DMVs, will close. Banks will be shut, but ATMs and online services remain accessible. Retailers and restaurants will largely operate, many offering veteran discounts. UPS and FedEx will have modified schedules. The next federal holidays are Thanksgiving and Christmas.

title: Pakistan bowler Naseem Shah's home attacked; heavy firing reported
content: Pakistan fast bowler Naseem Shah's family home in Lower Dir was fired upon by unknown assailants on November 10, though no family members were harmed. Police are investigating the incident. Naseem remains with the national team for their upcoming ODI series against Sri Lanka, a crucial part of their T20 World Cup preparations.

title: Delhi car blast: Who was Md Umar? The J&K doctor driving the car that exploded near Red Fort
content: A Kashmiri doctor, Mohammad Umar, is suspected of driving the car used in the Delhi Red Fort Metro Station parking blast. Police sources indicate a link to a Faridabad terror module where explosives were seized. CCTV footage shows a masked man in the vehicle. Umar, who is absconding, is believed to be associated with the Jaish-e-Mohammad terror group.

title: Microsoft techie laid off: Calls it a green light; 5 career comeback tips
content: Tatiana Teppoeva found liberation after a Microsoft layoff. She launched her own company, teaching executives presence. Her journey shows how job loss can spark career change. Professionals can use severance for skills development and rebrand themselves. Embracing a portfolio career or side hustle offers new paths. Shifting from victim to architect of one's career is key.

title: How ESA plans to make astronaut food from thin air for Moon and Mars missions
content: Europe's space agency is pioneering a groundbreaking project, HOBI-WAN, to generate protein from gases like hydrogen and carbon dioxide in space. This innovative technology, developed with Solar Foods, could provide astronauts with a sustainable food source, reducing reliance on Earth resupply missions for long-duration Moon and Mars journeys. The experiment aims to prove the viability of gas-based fermentation in microgravity.

title: 'Respond within 2 weeks': SC seeks EC reply on pleas challenging SIR
content: The Supreme Court has given the Election Commission two weeks to respond to petitions challenging the Special Intensive Revision exercise in West Bengal and Tamil Nadu. Parties like DMK, Congress, and TMC have filed these pleas, accusing the EC of a "malicious exercise." AIADMK has been permitted to join the case in support of the SIR exercise in Tamil Nadu.

title: Delhi car blast: New video surfaces showing explosion near Red Fort area; watch
content: A devastating car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort metro station, captured on CCTV, has claimed at least 12 lives and injured many. Authorities suspect a Kashmiri doctor, Mohammad Umar, linked to a terror module, drove the vehicle. Police are investigating the incident under UAPA, reviewing footage to track the suspect's movements.

title: Delhi air quality worsens, schools go hybrid; GRAP Stage III curbs enforced
content: Delhi schools are shifting to a hybrid learning model for students up to Class 5 due to soaring pollution levels. The decision follows the activation of Stage III anti-pollution measures as the city's Air Quality Index reached 425. This move ensures educational continuity while prioritizing student health amidst hazardous air quality.

title: ‘Cross-border terror’: India tells UNSC to enforce zero-tolerance; remark after-Delhi blast
content: India has informed the United Nations Security Council about its long-standing struggle with cross-border terrorism. This comes after a deadly explosion near the Red Fort metro station in Delhi. India highlighted the dangers of illicit arms trafficking to terrorist groups. The country urged consistent enforcement of arms embargoes. Effective international cooperation is deemed critical to combat this threat.

title: Early bets for Week 11: Bengals and Dolphins to cover, plus an MVP pick
content: the new England Patriots host the division rival New York Jets on "Thursday Night Football" the rest of the day features a plethora of marquee matchups, including the Tampa Bay Buccaneers visiting the Bills, the Seattle Seahawks and Los Angeles Rams . the Denver Broncos hosts the Kansas City Chiefs in a key AFC West clash .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: A drawn knife, an escape by train, a decorated military figure and Georgia Tech's first win
content: the first lieutenant, 33, arrived on horseback to the campus in the fall of 1893 . he registered as a "sub-apprentice" in a woodworking course so he could qualify . any aspirations of becoming a master craftsman, though, were secondary .

title: Awards Week predictions, results: Kurtz, Baldwin named Rookies of the Year
content: the most prestigious awards are the four major honors determined by BBWAA voting . the awards will have a lasting impact on baseball history books and Hall of Fame résumés . baseball will also hold its annual awards show in Las Vegas on Thursday .

title: Women's bantamweight top 10 undergoes an overhaul
content: a pair of women's bantamweight bouts have reshuffled the ESPN divisional rankings . Norma Dumont won a split decision over Ketlen Vieira on Nov. 1 . the only other movement in the rankings is at heavyweight .

title: Breaking down each team's City Edition uniform
content: the 2025-26 season marks the ninth campaign of the collaboration between the Nike and the NBA on the uniforms . this year's theme is all about "remixing" previous designs . the "Cream City" threads are back for the San Antonio Spurs and the "California Dream" for the Los Angeles Lakers .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12: Who's No. 2?
content: the selection committee will reveal its second of six rankings on Tuesday night . it will be the first loss of the season to be no. 2 on Tuesday . a deeper dive into the statistics and résumés of both undefeated teams will factor into their discussions .

title: Winners and losers: Taylor, Henderson shine; Jefferson, Darnold struggle
content: RB, Indianapolis colts : Jonathan Taylor scored 49.6 fantasy points . he tied for 36th on the all-time single-game list . the rushing score in the fourth quarter rallied his team from behind .

title: Solak's Week 10 lessons: What now for Brian Daboll, plus the 2024 QB class
content: the Giants fired coach Brian Daboll after 61 games at the helm . daboll's Giants are 2-8 for the third consecutive season and end 20-40-1 under his tenure . the most interesting headline to come out of the firing is that general manager Joe Schoen is keeping his job . every Tuesday, I'll spin the previous week of NFL action forward .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close ahead of the second ranking?
content: the college football playoff selection committee will have three main questions to answer . the answer will impact teams ranked 9-12 . teams labeled Still in the mix haven't been eliminated, but have work to do .

title: Passan's perfect move for 21 MLB teams that could go big this offseason
content: a deluge of moves is coming between now and the new year . there are caveats: at least one team on this list will sign multiple players . some players who could be on here are a stretch because of budgets .

title: Free agent pickups: Key additions to fuel your playoff hunt
content: the 10th Sunday of the season began with an exciting overtime affair in Germany . in the late afternoon, the Los Angeles Rams QB Matthew Stafford tossed four TD passes for a record third consecutive game . the team is still waiting for WR Garrett Wilson and Chicago Bears WR DJ Moore to score a fantasy point .

title: Bobby Marks' NBA Contract Year All-Stars: Reaves, Lakers lead 12-man lineup
content: the 2025-26 season is just three weeks old, and there are more than six months until the start of free agency . the court should not dissuade us from identifying 12 potential free agents who have stood out and what their future could hold with their respective teams . there are criteria to how we selected our lineup of contract-year All-Stars .

title: 🏈 College Football Power Ranks: 3 newcomers
content: Texas Tech is a legit threat for the college football playoff . but each squad has areas that can be sharpened for the stretch run . even teams much higher in the rankings, such as Oregon and Vanderbilt , came away from narrow wins with areas to clean up .

title: Elevated walkway planned to connect Bengaluru airport metro station with KIA Terminal 1
content: KIA, one of India’s fastest-growing airports, is currently handling more than 37 million passengers annually and aims to reach over 60 million passengers per year within the next five years, according to officials

title: After AK-47 recovery, Kashmir hospitals order audit of doctors’ lockers
content: In an official communiqué, the Medical Superintendent of GMC, Anantnag, directed all heads of departments “to identify lockers and almirahs in their respective departments and wards and to label them with the names of the staff members to whom they are allotted”

title: Naidu to hand over 3 lakh houses under ‘House for All’ scheme on November 12
content: Chief Minister to launch mass house-warming ceremony from Annamayya district; over 3 lakh PMAY houses completed across Andhra Pradesh, beneficiaries to receive keys virtually

title: SC says SIR is not the country’s first electoral roll revamp; Opposition retorts that this one is 'farcical'
content: Opposition parties say current SIR is a rushed exercise; ask why Bihar voter roll is included as a document proof for SIR 2.0; call for transparency through acknowledgement slips, machine-readable roll

title: Bengaluru City Commissioners review dog control measures
content: It is important to conduct public awareness programmes to inform citizens about the department’s initiatives0

title: Mirwaiz condemns Delhi blast; Engineer Rashid to go on hunger strike in Jail
content: Rashid, who is at the Tihar Jail, in Delhi, has decided to go on a two-day hunger strike against the attack from November 12, according to his party

title: Delhi explosion: Kin of terror suspects in shock and disbelief
content: Nabi, the main suspect, was a ‘religious person and passionate cricketer’, who laid emphasis on higher studies, says family member

title: Heavy rain likely to occur in isolated places in southern districts of T.N. on Wednesday
content: Light to moderate rain is likely to occur at a few places over south Tamil Nadu and at isolated places over north Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal.

title: KSRTC to offer complimentary Nandini snack kits on Flybus services
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy will launch the new service at Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport.

title: The Hindu Group’s Frontline launches collection of essays by Constitutional expert A.G. Noorani
content: The first few copies of the book were presented to Justice K. Chandru and Justice Prabha Sridevan, former judges of the Madras High Court, by N. Ram, Director, The Hindu Group Publishing Private Limited

title: Ministers review arrangements for Sri Sathya Sai Baba’s centenary celebrations in Puttaparthi
content: Group of Ministers led by Anagani Satyaprasad directs officials to ensure smooth conduct of week-long celebrations, with focus on traffic, sanitation, and medical facilities for devotees

title: Naidu urged to allocate land in MSME Park for bulk drug units
content: Bulk Drug Manufacturers Association of India seeks 1,000 acres of land in the newly inaugurated MSME Park in Prakasam district

title: Six Maoists killed in Bijapur encounter
content: Automatic weapons, Sten guns, .303 rifles, and explosives have been recovered from the encounter site; Chief Minister hails operation as “another decisive step” to eliminate Maoism

title: Protest against seaplane project held in Kochi
content: Fisherfolk allege that the seaplane initiative will affect the livelihoods of local fishers in Kochi and other identified areas

title: Centre sanctions ₹358.82 crore for rural roads and bridges in Andhra Pradesh under PM-JANMAN
content: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announces projects to boost connectivity and access to services in tribal regions; tendering to be completed within a week, works targeted for completion by 2025–26

title: Ex-forest officer’s book sheds light on Kerala’s dark underbelly of wildlife trade and superstitions
content: The author shares real-life undercover operations conducted by the Forest department to curb the illegal trade in tiger skins and other wildlife products

title: Water supply being restored, claims KWA  a day after storage tank collapse in Kochi
content: Repair work was carried out on a war footing to avert water scarcity, and pumping began from the second chamber of the water storage tank, says Minister

title: BJP counters YSRCP’s ‘privatisation’ charge, defends PPP model
content: Yamini says the PPP model is being misrepresented by YSRCP; clarifies that hospitals and services remain under government control, ensuring free and quality healthcare for the poor

title: Bihar election exit polls 2025 date and time: How and where to watch exit poll projections
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Delhi blast: First lead to terror plot came from Jaish posters in J&K; attack in works for 2 yrs?
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. Read More

title: Bihar exit polls: Voters reject Kishor's Jan Suraaj? What pollsters say

title: Centre working to create 10 crore ‘Lakhpati Didis’, says Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Says the Centre and the Andhra Pradesh government are jointly implementing programmes to strengthen rural livelihoods through watershed development, sustainable agriculture, and women-centric initiatives

title: CPI(M) slams Visakha summit agenda, demands all-party meet on voters’ list revision
content: Party’s State Secretariat passes resolutions on SIR process, cyclone relief, tenant farmers’ compensation, and withdrawal of power and medical college privatisation plans

title: Police urge Sabarimala devotees to follow virtual queue, safety guidelines
content: Police warn that unregulated arrivals can disrupt crowd management, affect the smooth flow of devotees, and create safety concerns. Pilgrims therefore should secure a  virtual queue slot before starting their journey

title: Veligonda project will turn drought-prone areas of Prakasam district to fertile lands: CM
content: Assures to complete the project by 2026 and provide water to Kanigiri, Yerragondapalem, Giddalur and Markapuram areas

title: Chief Secretary directs DISCOMs to expedite solar rooftop programme
content: Vijayanand says Andhra Pradesh is committed to clean, affordable energy; Kuppam Constituency to be developed as 100% solar and Net Zero with ADB, NABARD support

title: Karnataka ranks fourth in the country for adoptions
content: Despite growing interest, State faces shortage of adoptable children; 2,271 parents await while only 79 children are available

title: NCD-4 survey shows better cancer screening outcomes in Andhra Pradesh
content: Over 22,000 women identified for further tests as Health Department ramps up screening and awareness efforts, says Health Minister

title: Naidu inaugurates 49 MSME Parks across 17 districts in Andhra Pradesh
content: Also virtually inaugurates 38 mega industrial units set up across A.P. with an investment of ₹25,256 crore; Industries Department has set up 50 MSME projects at a cost of ₹873 crore in a total area of 868 acres in the State

title: Tribal entrepreneurs are drivers of India’s progress: Tribal Affairs Minister
content: The Tribal Business Conclave is part of the Birsa Munda 150th birth anniversary celebrations; it is expected to facilitate business linkages and attract investments for tribal entrepreneurs across India

title: More support for protest against industries causing pollution in Koppal
content: Agitation organised jointly by the District Bachao Andolan Samiti and the Parisara Hitarakshana Vedike in front of the CMC complex enters 12th day

title: Exceeding total coliform levels detected at Pathalam bund stretch of Periyar
content: The total coliform count near the bund was 2,600 MPN per 100 ml in samples collected on August 5, 2025, according to test results from the Kerala State Pollution Control Board

title: Delhi Red Fort blast: Security measures tightened at airports
content: Security at all access control points at the airport will be enhanced, and random checking at passenger terminal gates and that of baggage have been ordered

title: Former Travancore Devaswom Board Commissioner N. Vasu arrested in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Officials say the SIT’s primary case was that the TDB-level miscategorisation of the gilded encasings as made of pure copper was patently false, possibly facilitating the alleged pilferage

title: Udhayanidhi Stalin distributes skill training certificates, incentive cheques to 170 youth
content: The youth had completed training under the Vetri Nichayam scheme of the Tamil Nadu Skill Development Corporation

title: ISRO completes key test on main parachutes for Gaganyaan Crew Module
content: The test was conducted at Babina Field Firing Range in Uttar Pradesh as part of ongoing series of Integrated Main Parachute Airdrop Tests for the qualification of parachute system for the mission

title: Ugar Sugar Mill agrees to pay ₹3,300 per tonne in the wake of protest
content: Farmers stage a huge protest after learning that the management of the mill in Belagavi district has decided to pay ₹3,250 per tonne of sugarcane

title: Press Club of India condemns remarks against journalists by Bangladesh Chief Advisor’s spokesperson
content: The remarks referred to reporters from several outlets in India and abroad who interviewed former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina recently

title: What kind of projects need environmental, coastal or forest clearance — and how the process works
content: Under the Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification, 2006, issued under the Environment (Protection) Act, any project that could significantly alter land use or affect air, water, or ecosystems must obtain prior Environmental Clearance (EC).

title: Andhra Pradesh seeks ₹6,384 crore relief from Centre after Cyclone Montha
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu appeals for financial aid to rebuild agriculture, irrigation, infrastructure, and support affected families

title: Moolamattom power plant to be shut down from Wednesday
content: To ensure drinking water availability in Idukki and Ernakulam districts, water flow through the Periyar Valley and Muvattupuzha Valley canals will be increased

title: Remedial efforts to curb microplastic pollution along Edayar industrial stretch in Periyar hit roadblock
content: The defunct company’s management refused to undertake remedial work, claiming the one-acre dumping site near the river belonged to Kadungalloor panchayat

title: Security tightened in public places, sensitive areas
content: Following the blast in New Delhi which resulted in several casualties, an alert has been sounded across the country

title: INA was not founded by Netaji, he took up the reins only later, says new book
content: Gautam Hazarika’s The Forgotten Indian Prisoners of World War II says it was Subhas Chandra Bose who was responsible for its wider recognition as a force against Britian

title: Devotees throng Mannarasala
content: Devotees gather for the ‘Pooyam Thozhal’ ritual in connection with the  Ayilyam festival. The sanctum sanctorum of the temple will be opened at 4 a.m. for the Ayilyam festival on Wednesday.
